III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section Rule 109. (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents; needs, implementation of treatment plans,
and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth returned from a home visit and appeared high. The youth's
mother called the facility and indicated that the youth stole a
marijuana pen from the home while visiting. Youth was not
searched upon re-entry to the facility and shared the marijuana
pen with two other youth.
Investigation This complaint was received on 3/13/23 and jointly investigated
with the Government Worker. The complaint noted the following:
Youth A (11-12) is placed at Vista Maria. Youth A has visitation
outside of Vista Maria at her unknown mother's home. Additional
information about Youth A's mother or visitation are unknown.
On 03/06/23, Youth A returned to Vista Maria from a home visit at
her mother's home. Youth A appeared to be "high" based on her
behavior being off. Youth A's mother later called Vista Maria and
indicated that Youth A had stolen a marijuana pen from her home
while she was visiting. Youth A later shared the marijuana pen
with two other unknown residents who also reside at Vista Maria.
Youth A was supposed to be searched after returning to Vista
Maria but was not properly searched and the marijuana pen was
not initially located. The pen was not located until Youth A's
mother contacted Vista Maria and Youth A's room was searched.
The complainant was a staff member and prefers not to be
identified. No contact with the complainant was able to be made
as no contact information was provided.
2

Youth A’s foster care worker was notified of the investigation on
3/13/23.
I interviewed Youth A in collaboration with the Government worker
on 3/14/23 at the facility. Youth A reported she went on a home
visit for her birthday, from February 16-22. Youth A reported while
at home her mother gave her two vape pens. One vape had
nicotine in it and the other had marijuana. Youth A reported they
were given to her, and her mother called the facility later and
reported Youth A had stolen them. Youth A reported when she
returned to the facility on 2/22/23 she was searched by staff.
Youth A reported she had to take off her shoes and socks and
shake them out. She reported she popped her pants waistband
and bra band and was gone over with the metal detector wand.
Her bags were also searched, emptied, and all the items in her
bags were gone over with the metal detector wand. Youth A
reported she brought the vape pens into the facility in her boot
lining and it went undetected. Youth A reported she shared the
vape pens with Youths B, C, and D. Youth A reported she had the
vape pens on the unit for three days and they used the pens all
three days. Youth A reported the vapes were used in the
bathroom. They would leave the vapes in the bathroom on a
railing or inside the toilet paper roll. Youth A reported they also
concealed them on their person or in their rooms. Youth A
reported the facility does security checks three times a day, but
they did not find the vape pens.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 3/14/23 in collaboration with
the Government Worker. Youth B reported she lives on the same
wing as Youth A, and she noticed after Youth A's return the girls
were whispering so she asked Youth A if she had brought
something back. Youth B reported she used the nicotine vape a
couple times and she concealed it a couple times in her room.
Youth B denied using the marijuana pen. Youth B reported Youth
A got the vape pens into the facility in her boot a couple weeks
ago. Youth B reported they had the vape pens for two days. Youth
B reported staff did room checks and did not find the vape pens
and she turned them over to staff after the checks. Youth B
reported she had concealed them inside a hole in her pillow.
Youth B reported there were three vape pens and that she turned
over two and Youth A was gone over with the metal detector
wand, and they found the other one. Youth B reported Youth A's
mother gave the vape pens to Youth A.
I interviewed Youth C on 3/14/23 at the facility in collaboration with
the Government Worker. Youth C reported she was the person
3

who told staff about the vape pens. Youth C reported the vape
pens to Youth Coach A. Youth C is on a safety plan for her
protection after telling about the vape pens. Youth C reported the
girls were asking each other if they were high and that is when
she decided to tell. Youth C reported they did security checks after
she reported the vape pens and they checked her room also so
that the other girls wouldn't know she was the person who told.
Youth C reported they checked all the rooms and did not find the
vapes, so she gave them to the staff.
I interviewed Youth D at the facility on 3/14/23 in collaboration with
the Government Worker. Upon entering the room Youth D stated,
"I had contraband and don't want to talk about it". She reported
she used the vape pens once and refused to talk more about it.
I interviewed Team Leader A at the facility on 3/14/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Team Leader A
reported that Youth A brought the vape pens back from a home
visit. She reported there were two vape pens one having nicotine
and the other having marijuana. Team Leader A reported the
mother called and reported items missing from her home after her
daughter's home visit. Team Leader A reported the mother was
missing ear buds, a watch, and the vape pens. Team Leader A
reported that Youth A returned on a Tuesday, and Wednesday
they were told about the vape pens and they were located. Team
Leader A reported the youth had the pens for one day. Team
Leader A reported a youth turned them in after room searches.
Team Leader A reported that when a youth returns from a home
pass, they are searched which includes a bag search, that youth
pop their waistband and bra and they remove their shoes and
socks and shake them out. Team Leader A reported youth have to
empty their pockets and the youth, and their items are gone over
with a wand that detects metal items. Team Leader A reported
Youth A was searched when she returned from her home visit.
Team Leader A did not do the search. Team Leader A reported
Youth A brought the vape pens into the wing concealed inside her
boot lining. Team Leader A reported she was involved in the room
searches but not the search of Youth A. Team Leader A reported
staff did come to her and reported the youth seemed off. Team
Leader A said they seemed drowsy and mellow.
I interviewed Youth Coach A at the facility on 3/14/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth Coach A
reported the girls were talking to their peers more than usual on
the day Youth A brought the vape pens into the facility. Youth
Coach A reported Youth D appeared high as her eyes were very
4

red. Youth Coach A reported this to the Supervisor working.
Youth Coach A reported they did room searches and then Youth B
gave two vape pens to staff. She reported the youth said there
was a third one, but she doesn't know what happened with that.
Youth Coach A reported she did not check in Youth A when she
returned from her visit as supervisors do the checks. Youth Coach
A reported that Therapist A did the check in of Youth A.
I interviewed Therapist A at the facility on 3/14/23 with the
Government Worker. She reported she received a call that Youth
D was using a vape pen that a peer had brought into the facility.
Therapist 1 reported she didn't check in Youth A and that Youth
A's Therapist (Therapist B) checked her in.
I interviewed Team Leader B on 3/14/23 at the facility in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Team Leader B
reported she did the search of Youth A's bag and Therapist B did
the search of Youth A. Team Leader B reported she searched
Youth A's bag by removing all the items and shaking them out.
She also went over the items in her bag with the wand/metal
detector. Team Leader B reported she did not find anything of
concern and remembers Youth A having some lotions and body
sprays. Team Leader B reported that Therapist B searched Youth
A. Team Leader B reported Therapist B had Youth A snap her
bra and waistband, pull out her pockets, take off her shoes and
socks and shake them. Team Leader B said Therapist B also ran
the wand over Youth A's body.
I interviewed Therapist B on 3/14/23 at the facility in collaboration
with the Government Worker. Therapist B reported Youth A was
on a pass over mid-winter break, and she was staying with her
cousin and could visit with her mom during the day. Therapist B
reported when Youth A returned, she and Team Leader B
checked Youth A in. Therapist B described the search she did with
Youth A. She reported she had Youth A empty her pockets, take
off her shoes and shake them, take off her socks and shake them,
had her pop her clothing bands and used the wand to go over
Youth A's body. Therapist B reported nothing was found in the
search. Therapist B reported they did room searches and did not
locate the vape pens. Therapist B reported Youth A verified that
she brought the vape pens into the facility in the “squishy” part of
her boots.
I interviewed Youth Coach B on 3/14/23 at the facility in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth Coach B
reported she assisted with the search of the girls’ rooms. She
5

reported they searched Youths A, B, C, and D's rooms and did not
find the vape pens. Youth Coach B reported Youth B turned in the
vape pens. Youth Coach B reported the girls seemed out of it and
it was obvious something was going on with them. She reported
that Youth D's words were all jumbled up and her words didn't
make sense. Youth Coach B reported Youth A was very laid back
and she is usually combative.
I interviewed Youth Coach C on 3/20/23 via phone in collaboration
with the Government Worker. Youth Coach C reported that on
2/22/23 the youth were in their rooms for personal time. When
personal time was over Youth A and Youth D didn't come out of
their rooms right away. About 15 minutes later Youth A came out
of her room and took her medication and was very calm and had a
hoodie on. Youth D also came out of her room and was wearing a
hoodie and was also very quiet. Youth Coach C noticed that Youth
A and Youth D were frequently talking which was not the norm for
either of them. Youth D asked Youth Coach C to get her some
water and Youth Coach C said she noticed that Youth D
appeared high. Youth Coach C asked her why she looked like
that, and Youth D indicated it was her medication causing her to
be high. Youth Coach C reported she went and asked the Team
Leader who said Youth D's medication does not affect her that
way. Youth Coach C reported they then did room checks and did
not find anything. Youth Coach C reported Youth A told her the
youth that had used the vape pens. Youth B then turned over the
two vape pens to Youth Coach C at the end of the shift. Youth
Coach C reported she took the vape pens and gave them to the
Team Leader.
I attempted to interview Youth E via phone on 3/20/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth E was
discharged from the facility on 2/27/23. Youth E did not return the
call.
I interviewed the Right's Officer at the facility on 3/14/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. He reported that the
facility attempted to drug screen the youth involved (Youths A, B,
C and D). Youth D was positive for marijuana and the other three
youth's workers/or judge denied permission to test them.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
I reviewed the facility’s policy on client privacy which details the
search procedure. The search procedure is to have clients remove
their shoes and socks and shake them out. The clients are to pull
the waistband of their pants out as well as their bra that encircles
6

their torso away from their body and they are to empty their
pockets.
Incident report dated 2/22/23 completed by Team Leader A was
reviewed. The report indicates that Youth Coach C informed
Team Leader A that the behaviors of Youth A and Youth D are
coming off as peculiar. Incident report indicates Youths A, B, D
and E were passing around a vape pen while concealing it. Three
of those residents' rooms were searched and nothing was found.
Youth B turned over the two vape pens to Youth Coach C after the
search of the rooms. One vape pen was cannabis, and the other
was nicotine.
Analysis Based upon the interviews there is no evidence that supports the
staff did not follow the agency search policy. The youth was able
to conceal vape pens in her boot lining that search procedures did
not detect. All staff interviewed and Youth A described the search
procedure the same, and this is the procedure that was followed
when searching Youth A.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE: The search of shoes/boots should
include a staff member looking inside the youth’s footwear with a
flashlight to ensure items are not being concealed in the lining or
under the shoe insert.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
